title: Recent homes sales in Greater Boston (Feb. 11)
author: The Boston Globe
bullets: Recent home sales include 144 Helen Drive in Abington, a raised ranch, sold for $735,000.
Prominent sale in Arlington: 56 Valentine Road, a Colonial, sold for $2,100,000.
Boston's 25 Upton St., a row-middle home, sold for $4,035,000, the highest in the area.

title: Hundreds of students displaced after burst pipe closes UMass Boston dorm
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A burst sprinkler pipe displaced hundreds of UMass Boston students from East Residence Hall due to flooding.
Approximately 50 rooms on floors 2-10 experienced water damage; students received limited relocation information.
UMass Boston offers temporary housing and shuttle services; East Residence dining hall reopens Wednesday.

title: Seattle Public Library schools the Boston Public Library with book recommendations for Patriots fans
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Seattle Public Library suggests over 35 Seattle-themed books to Boston Public Library after Patriots' Super Bowl loss.
Recommendations include Michael Bennett's memoir and various lighthearted titles with references to New England's football defeat.
Both libraries participate in "Books Unbanned", promoting unrestricted reading access for teens nationwide.

title: State auditor sues Beacon Hill to force compliance with audit
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: State Auditor Diana DiZoglio sues Massachusetts Legislature to enforce her authority to audit, as approved by voters.
Attorney General Andrea Campbell declines to support DiZoglio, questioning her authority and alleging political motives behind the audit push.
Defendants in the lawsuit include House Speaker Ronald Mariano and Senate President Karen Spilka; DiZoglio backed by Republican candidates.

title: Man arrested in Seaport, charged with human trafficking
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Schineider Dave Macean, 23, was arrested in Seaport by Boston Police for charges including human trafficking.
The arrest followed a sting operation conducted by the Boston Police Human Trafficking Unit and State Police.
Macean is set to be arraigned in South Boston District Court, facing multiple trafficking-related charges.

title: As Boston residents report daytime coyote sightings, here’s how to stay safe
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Eastern coyotes are being spotted more frequently in Boston during their mating season from January to March.
MassWildlife advises keeping pets indoors and hazing coyotes with loud noises to prevent encounters.
Coyote attacks on humans in Massachusetts are rare, with fewer than 10 incidents in the past 60 years.

title: Cam Newton reverses course with his comments on Drake Maye after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Cam Newton, previously critical of Drake Maye, praised his performance after New England's Super Bowl loss to Seattle.
Drake Maye completed 27-of-43 passes for 295 yards, two TDs, two interceptions, and a lost fumble in the Super Bowl.
Despite postseason struggles, Maye was the MVP runner-up, highlighting a promising future for the Patriots.

title: James Hagens wins Beanpot MVP as Bruins prospects thrive in tournament
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: James Hagens won the 2026 Beanpot MVP, contributing two assists in Boston College's 6-2 win over Boston University.
Hagens, a Bruins top prospect, has 31 points in 24 games this season and is developing into a well-rounded player.
BC's Andre Gasseau and Dean Letourneau, both Bruins prospects, also had standout performances against BU in the Beanpot.

title: Patriots CB Carlton Davis shares his pitch to free agents ahead of busy offseason
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots cornerback Carlton Davis emphasizes the positive culture in New England as a draw for free agents.
The team boasts $42.7 million in cap space and may restructure contracts to attract new talent.
Patriots, with young talent and a strong season, aim to be a top destination for NFL free agents.

title: Sticker shock for a dealerâ€™s quote to replace a starter
author: John Paul
bullets: A dealership quoted $1,200 to replace a starter on a 2014 Honda Accord EX, higher than the car owner expected.
The actual cost of a new starter, including labor, should be around $925, based on labor rates and AllData pricing.
Dealership repair costs can be 30-36% higher than independent shops, suggesting the owner seek an AAA Approved Repair shop.
